body_html:
Canonicalize changed because it needs to return a new graph (to ensure the unique numbers are correct, for expect-style testing). It was possible before because of the indirection through TracerState. Without the indirection, we need to return a new value to python.
…
On Sun, Apr 15, 2018 at 12:27 PM, Adam Paszke ***@***.***> wrote: Why did we need to switch Canonicalize to a different signature? It's not great, because if someone tries to use it like any other pass then it will basically be a no-op. — You are receiving this because your review was requested. body:
Canonicalize changed because it needs to return a new graph (to ensure the
unique numbers are correct, for expect-style testing). It was possible
before because of the indirection through TracerState. Without the
indirection, we need to return a new value to python.

On Sun, Apr 15, 2018 at 12:27 PM, Adam Paszke <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Why did we need to switch Canonicalize to a different signature? It's not
> great, because if someone tries to use it like any other pass then it will
> basically be a no-op.
>
> —
